translation.ko: 그의 이름을 부르고 멈추고 소리를 들었습니다 "제프 데이비 유엔 군사 고문, 이라크"

translation.en: Move a meter, call out, stop, listen.
There was this other fellow who was running towards the rubble,
who was in US military uniform.
I said, "Who are you?" And he said, "My name's Bill."
The gentleman in a blue UN baseball cap came up and he said,
translation.ko: 파란색 유엔 야구 모자를 쓴 남자가 오더니 말했어요

translation.en: something to the effect of like, "Where are the rest of your guys?"
And I said, "There are no rest of our guys,
it's me and a captain right now."
I want to go in the building and do an internal reconnaissance and see.
translation.ko: 건물 안으로 들어가 내부 정찰을 하고 싶었죠

translation.en: I must be nuts to even think about going in the building.
translation.ko: 그런 생각을 하다니 정신이 나간 게 틀림없습니다

translation.en: But firefighters have this thing, we run into burning buildings
translation.ko: 하지만 불타는 건물에서 모두가 뛰어나갈 때

translation.en: when everybody else is running out of burning buildings.
We made our way upstairs and it was almost unrecognizable.
translation.ko: 위층으로 갔는데 거의 형체를 알아볼 수가 없었어요

translation.en: I'd been up there on many occasions, for meetings...
translation.ko: 회의 참석차 여러 번 가 본 터라...

translation.en: As we walked along, I was looking
and at one point I found a little spot of light down below.
If you looked in there, I could see two people.
[Loescher] The flash is what I remember.
The ceiling collapsed, the floor collapsed.
We were thrust down.
I heard someone say, "Oh, shit!"
As if someone had expected it.
I'm pretty sure it was Sérgio.
The next thing I remember is regaining consciousness
and not being able to move.
I remember looking up, um...
at, at someone...
who was wearing a... like a fireman's hat or, or helmet,
translation.ko: 소방관 모자나 헬멧 같은 걸 쓰고 있었죠

translation.en: and, and I sort of waved at him.
It may sound melodramatic, but honestly from looking at it
translation.ko: 멜로드라마처럼 들릴지도 모르겠지만 솔직히 그걸 보면서

translation.en: I was pretty convinced that this was gonna be a one-way trip. Um...
translation.ko: 살아서 못 나가겠구나 싶은 확신이 들었습니다

translation.en: You know, I'd seen Oklahoma City done enough collapse-rescue stuff,
translation.ko: 오클라호마시티 테러 때 구조 작업을 많이 봤는데

translation.en: and the building, it was still moving.
Uh, you know, bricks were still falling,
it was, you know, within a few minutes of the blast.
I was kind of convinced this was a one-way trip,
and I said, you know, "Tell my wife and, uh, my daughter I love them."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말했어요, 아내랑 딸한테 사랑한다고 전해달라고요

translation.en: I took my body armor off and started to climb down the hole.
translation.ko: 전 방탄복을 벗고 구멍 아래로 내려갔습니다

translation.en: I got down to about... [sighs] where the first floor would be.
At that point I had to turn around in a space
and basically slide down head first, so I could get next to him.
translation.ko: 머리를 먼저 아래로 밀어 넣어 그 사람 옆에 닿았습니다

translation.en: And fortunately there was a piece of reinforcing rod, a rebar,
translation.ko: 다행히도 콘크리트에서 삐져나온 철근이 하나 있어서

translation.en: that was sticking out of a concrete and I put my shoulder up against that.
translation.ko: 다행히도 콘크리트에서 삐져나온 철근이 하나 있어서 어깨를 거기에 댈 수 있었죠

translation.en: It was perfect, where I could basically lean down
translation.ko: 아주 완벽했던 게 제가 그 덕분에 이렇게 기울여서

translation.en: and, you know, touch them.
translation.ko: 그들한테 손을 갖다 댈 수 있었거든요

translation.en: Um, and that's when I first introduced myself when I said,
you know, "My name is Bill. I'm a civilian EMT. I'm from the army unit.
I promise I'm gonna get you guys out of here alive."
I remember saying my name to that person.
translation.ko: 그 사람에게 이름을 말한 걸 기억합니다

translation.en: Telling him that my name was Gil.
I remember very little else.
One gentleman said "My name is Gil," and he was directly in front of me.
translation.ko: 한 분이 자신은 길이라고 했어요 바로 제 앞에 있었죠

translation.en: There was another gentleman, and he said his name was Sérgio.
translation.ko: 한 분이 또 있었는데 세르지우라고 했습니다

translation.en: As we're talking, you know, he starts to say, I thought he initially said,
translation.ko: 대화를 시작했고 그의 첫 마디가 제가 기억하기론

translation.en: "Don't pull me out." And I said, "Don't worry. We're gonna get you both out.
translation.ko: '날 철수시키지 마세요'였어요 전, '걱정 마십시오 두 분 모두 꺼내드릴 겁니다' 했죠

translation.en: I promise we'll get you both out."
translation.ko: 전, '걱정 마십시오 두 분 모두 꺼내드릴 겁니다' 했죠

translation.en: And he goes, "No, no. Don't let them pull the mission out."
translation.ko: 그러니까, '아니, 사람들이 미션을 철수시키지 않게 해요'

translation.en: And at this point, I'm still not sure who he is.
translation.ko: 아직도 전 그가 누군지 확신이 없었어요

translation.en: Then he's asking about, you know, the other people.
translation.ko: 그런 후에 그는 다른 사람들에 대해 물었죠

translation.en: "How many people are killed? How many people are wounded?
Do we know what happened?"
And suddenly I'm dawning, this guy's somebody who's, you know, in charge.
translation.ko: 그때 책임자 자리에 있는 사람이란 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: It's not just a worker, he's asking questions as the guy in charge.
translation.ko: 일개 직원이 아니라 책임 있는 자리의 사람이 하는 질문이었죠

translation.en: And it dawned on me, "Jesus, this is Sérgio de Mello."
translation.ko: 그때 깨달았어요 '이런, 세르지우 데 멜루 판무관이다'

translation.en: He had such perfect teeth.
He was a happy boy, always laughing,
translation.ko: 늘 웃고 쾌활했죠 "질다 비에이라 데 멜루" 세리지우의 모친"

translation.en: always in a good mood.
People would ask him to sing everywhere.
translation.ko: 어딜 가나 사람들이 걔한테 노래를 시켰어요

translation.en: When he was about three years old he could sing in four languages.
We moved to Italy.
There he attended a Catholic school.
[Power in English] Sérgio was the son of a Brazilian diplomat,
so he spent most of his childhood years abroad, in Europe, mainly.
translation.ko: 그래서 그는 유년기의 대부분을 타국에서 보냈어요, 주로 유럽요

translation.en: In Genoa, in Milan, in Rome,
uh, Naples, and even in Beirut.
Through that vagabond life, this was just second nature to him.
translation.ko: 그런 인생을 살면서 방랑자라는 제2의 천성을 얻었죠

translation.en: His capacity to just descend into a new place and look around and say,
translation.ko: 새로운 곳에 가도 쓱 훑어보곤 이럴 줄 아는 사람이었어요

translation.en: "Okay, I'm home."
And then finally he went to a French school
at the Sorbonne
where he studied philosophy.
[Power in English] He became activated politically,
partly by the philosophy, and mainly by what was going on
translation.ko: 철학 때문이기도 했지만 크게는 당시 소르본 대학 교정의 분위기가 원인이었어요

translation.en: on the campus of the Sorbonne at that time.
translation.ko: 크게는 당시 소르본 대학 교정의 분위기가 원인이었어요

translation.en: It was 1968, war in Vietnam was raging,
um, students and workers throughout France were striking.
translation.ko: 프랑스 전역의 학생, 노동자들이 파업을 일으키고 있었죠

translation.en: And of course in May of '68,
the students ended up affectively taking over the campus.
Sérgio manned the barricades, threw stones at the police.
translation.ko: 세르지우는 바리게이트를 치고 경찰에 돌을 던졌어요

translation.en: What's amazing about his politics in those days is,
how dogmatic he is,
how virulent his anti-Americanism, his anti-imperialism,
even his Marxism or Neo-Marxism is.
I mean, he is a revolutionary to the core.
He graduated from the Sorbonne in 1969.
One of his best friends lived in Geneva,
translation.ko: 절친 중 한 명이 제네바에 살아서

translation.en: and Sérgio, looking for work, went and crashed at his place.
translation.ko: 일자리를 찾던 세르지우는 그 집에 잠시 머물게 됐습니다

translation.en: Got some interviews with international organizations,
and ended up at the UN High Commissioner for Refugees.
translation.ko: 최종적으로 유엔 난민 고등 판무관실에 가게 됐습니다

translation.en: [McNamara] Those of us who joined in the '70s really worked on Third World issues.
translation.ko: 70년대에 합류한 저희들은 제3세계의 현안들을 많이 맡았죠

translation.en: It was well regarded,
it was expanding rapidly,
it had an interesting mandate of not just aid, but also protection,
translation.ko: 의무사항 중 흥미로운 건 원조도 보호도 안 된단 거였죠

translation.en: it was politically very active in the sense,
that it was on hot borders and conflict areas.
The turning point of Sérgio's relationship to his new place of employment
translation.ko: 세르지우가 새로운 자리와의 관계에 있어 전환점을 맞은 건

translation.en: was his first field mission,
uh, which was in Bangladesh.
Here Sérgio is tasked as a very young man to help provide shelter,
translation.ko: 아주 젊었던 세르지우가 맡은 일은 난민들에게 쉼터를 제공하고

translation.en: to help provide food, um, to try to come up with some kind of political strategy
translation.ko: 음식을 제공하고 좋은 정치적 전략을 짜내

translation.en: by which these people could eventually return to their homes.
translation.ko: 이들이 결국 고향으로 돌아가게 하는 거였는데

translation.en: He discovered himself.
He suddenly saw extreme poverty, enormous refugee flows,
translation.ko: 갑자기 깨달았어요 극심한 빈곤과 엄청난 난민 행렬

translation.en: and the ideals that had motivated him took life, they took flesh.
translation.ko: 그리고 그에게 동기유발이 돼준 이상들이 그 사람들의 목숨을 앗아간단 걸요

translation.en: He realized that he was not merely a man of thought,
translation.ko: 그는 자신이 단순히 생각하는 데서 그치지 않고

translation.en: but that if he wanted to make those ideals real,
he had to be a man of action.
translation.ko: 행동하는 사람이 돼야 한단 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: [McNamara] I met Sérgio first time actually in Swaziland in 1976,
to move the Soweto kids who'd been attacked by the South African police,
out of Swaziland to Tanzania.
This was a very hot operation, as you can imagine
translation.ko: 굉장히 힘든 작전이었어요 상상할 수 있듯

translation.en: the South African security were all over the place,
translation.ko: 남아공의 보안 세력이 사방에 깔려 있었으니까요

translation.en: but we evacuated them through Mozambique.
Sérgio was the acting UNHCR person in Maputo.
[Richard Holbrooke] I met Sérgio Vieira de Mello in Cambodia and Thailand
translation.ko: 전 세르지우 비에이라 데 멜루를 캄보디아와 태국에서 만났습니다

translation.en: when the Khmer Rouge were driven out of power
and a massive refugee crisis ensued.
This is what brought a whole generation of people
translation.ko: 전 세대의 사람들을 세계의 인도주의적 노력에 "리처드 홀브루크 전 유엔주재 미 대사"

translation.en: into the international humanitarian effort.
translation.ko: "리처드 홀브루크 전 유엔주재 미 대사" 동참시키게 된 일이었죠

translation.en: You're a better agronomist than I am.
[grunts] Voilà.
[Holbrooke] Sérgio was the most dazzling, charismatic person in that area.
translation.ko: 세르지우는 그 분야에서 가장 눈부시고 카리스마가 넘쳤죠

translation.en: [Sérgio] I better not shower him.
translation.ko: 난 물 안 주는 게 좋겠는데요

translation.en: [Holbrooke] How could a guy this charismatic, this good looking,
be doing this kind of work?
Well, he was one of the bright stars, no question.
Probably, maybe, the brightest.
He was the master magician,
mediator, manager, massager of egos.
translation.ko: 중재인, 관리자, 타인의 자존감을 키워주는 사람이었습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Would you mind spelling your last name?
[chuckles] V-I-E-I-R-A D-E M-E-L-L-O.
The mission was to return between 350 and 400,000 refugees
translation.ko: 임무는 태국과의 국경에 있는 난민 캠프에서 "미에케 보스 세르지우의 보좌관, 캄보디아"

translation.en: who were primarily living on the borders with Thailand in refugee camps
for a prolonged period of time already
to return them ahead of the elections that were scheduled to take place.
Sérgio was convinced that the only way to make the repatriation a success
translation.ko: 세르지우는 본국 송환을 성공적으로 이끄는 유일한 방법은

translation.en: was to work with the Khmer Rouge.
But this was controversial because...
they were what they were. They, they...
Their senior leadership had been part of a genocidal regime.
[McNamara] He had a long fascination with evil genius.
translation.ko: 그는 악한 천재들에 오랫동안 매료돼 있었어요

translation.en: The mind of evil men and how they functioned and why.
translation.ko: 악한 사람들의 정신과 그게 어떻게, 왜 작동하는가에요

translation.en: Especially intellectual evil, as the Khmer Rouge were.
translation.ko: 특히 크메르 루주 같은 지능적인 악한 세력들에 말이죠

translation.en: There was no question it was high risk and it shouldn't have happened.
translation.ko: 의심의 여지 없이 위험하고 있어선 안 될 일이었습니다

translation.en: It was all done, um, in a bit of a...
an unorthodox way.
There was a meeting place which was in the middle of nowhere.
translation.ko: 어딘지 모르는 곳에서 만남이 예정돼 있었어요

translation.en: We had no idea where we were going.
I remember Sérgio's driver declared him, basically, insane.
translation.ko: 세르지우의 운전기사가 그더러 정신 나갔다고 한 말을 기억해요

translation.en: We had to walk through minefields.
There was no radio contact.
And it was an hour and a half by tractor trailer
translation.ko: 트랙터가 다니는 길을 따라 1시간 반을 달려

translation.en: to a miniscule kind of settlement headquarters.
translation.ko: 매우 작은 정착 본부 같은 데로 갔어요

translation.en: We spent the rest of the day there and evening and had discussions with them
translation.ko: 우린 거기서 날이 저물고 한밤중이 될 때까지

translation.en: about the land and where people could return.
translation.ko: 사람들이 돌아갈 장소에 대해 논의를 거듭했습니다

translation.en: It was just an extraordinary experience.
Sérgio never underestimated, of course, who he was dealing with
and what their, their historical baggage was,
translation.ko: 그들의 과거 행적이 어땠는지 절대 과소평가하지 않았죠, 하지만

translation.en: but that did not cause him to think that he shouldn't talk to them.
translation.ko: 그런 것들 때문에 대화를 꺼릴 생각은 없었습니다

translation.en: He wasn't a black or white kind of guy.
[McNamara] War Criminals, My Friends
is what his autobiography could have been called.
translation.ko: 그의 자서전에 붙여질 만 한 이름이었죠

translation.en: He was rather inclined to see a broader view, perhaps, than many of us would.
translation.ko: 그 누구보다 더 넓게 보고 싶어 했습니다

translation.en: Uh, I would be the dogmatic, uh...
human rights approach that these guys were war criminals
translation.ko: 그들은 전범이고 즉시 재판에 회부돼야 한다는

translation.en: and should be put on trial immediately.
He told me to stop, get off my high horse.
I think, and it was a breakthrough.
It was the first time that the UN,
and probably foreigners for that matter,
translation.ko: 그 문제에 관해선 어쩌면 이방인이었던 그들이

translation.en: were in touch with the official Khmer governing structure.
translation.ko: 크메르의 공식 통치 조직과 접촉하게 됐죠

translation.en: Sérgio managed to convince at least some leading members of the Khmer Rouge
translation.ko: 세르지우는 크메르 루주의 몇몇 지도자들을 설득했어요

translation.en: that cooperation with the international community
was a more constructive approach,
translation.ko: 더욱 건설적인 접근 방식이 될 것이고

translation.en: and more in their self-interest than sabotage.
translation.ko: 자신들의 이해 관계에도 도움이 될 거라고요

translation.en: More tangibly, he managed to produce one of the few concrete successes
translation.ko: 길고도, 굉장한 비용이 든 캄보디아에 대한 국제 개입에서

translation.en: of a long international
translation.ko: 얼마 안 되는 성공 중 하나를

translation.en: and a very expensive international engagement in Cambodia...
the return of 400,000 Cambodians to their homes.
[Bos] I think there was a huge sense of being vindicated.
translation.ko: 정당성을 인정받았단 느낌을 강하게 받는 것 같았습니다

translation.en: I think you can almost see a sense of satisfaction on his face
translation.ko: 그들이 자신들의 운명을 자신들의 손에 쥐게 된 데에 대한

translation.en: that they're able to take their destiny in their own hands.
May they be blessed with happiness, lasting peace, and prosperity.
translation.ko: 그들이 행복과 영원한 평화와 번성을 누리길 바랍니다

translation.en: We are all here betting on peace.
We will, as from this morning,
and with deep emotion, escort you home.
translation.ko: 깊은 마음을 담아 여러분을 집으로 안내할 것입니다

translation.en: Thank you.
From that point forward, he wasn't just a UN success story,
translation.ko: 그 시점부터 그는 단순히 유엔의 한 성공 사례나

translation.en: or a humanitarian success story,
he was an individual that governments thought about as a problem solver,
as a troubleshooter, as a go-to guy.
As someone that you could put into harm's way,
have talk to the world's most dangerous people,
and he could somehow pull rabbits out of the hat.
translation.ko: 어느 정도의 해법을 얻을 수 있는 사람으로 말이죠

translation.en: I already looked at him like 007.
He never dies.
I asked him one time, "Sérgio,
translation.ko: 한 번은 이렇게 물은 적이 있어요

translation.en: why do you go to all these countries,
translation.ko: '왜 그렇게 분쟁이 심하고' "안드레 시몽이스 세르지우의 조카"

translation.en: that have such conflicts, that are so dangerous?"
He just laughed
and didn't reply.
[Vance Kuhner] It sounded to me like a 500-pound bomb
had gone off, and very close.
I went down on one knee
translation.ko: 한쪽 무릎을 꿇고 있다가 "밴스 쿠너 대위, 육군 헌병 부대"

translation.en: and when I stood back up again, I looked at my first sergeant and I said,
"Let's go. Let's get in the truck."
My driver said, "Where to go?" I said, "You see the smoke?
translation.ko: 운전병이 어디로 가냐길래 '저기 연기 보이죠?' "안드레 발렌틴" 의무병, 예비역"

translation.en: Follow the smoke."
My philosophy of the UN was not 100%.
translation.ko: 유엔에 대한 제 철학은 100% 믿음이 아니었습니다

translation.en: The UN believes a lot of talking will solve all the problems,
translation.ko: 유엔은 많은 대화를 통해 문제가 해결될 거로 보지만

translation.en: and they don't.
Sometimes you need to have brute force.
On that day it didn't make any difference.
There were people there that needed our help,
and my job was to accomplish that.
translation.ko: 제 임무는 그들을 성공적으로 돕는 것이었죠

translation.en: [Kuhner] I wasn't prepared for what I'd saw.
Mass chaos.
Wounded people everywhere.
I saw one man, he had a piece of rebar that was stuck through his cheeks
translation.ko: 어떤 남자는 철근 한 조각이 뺨에 박힌 채

translation.en: and he was sitting there smoking a cigarette.
Absolute insanity.
Time was our enemy.
We needed to start moving people.
[Valentine] It looked like a car bomb came in
and it was setting off all the other vehicles that were next to it.
We had people that were crawling out of the building.
So I said, "Okay, I'll take control of this."
This little section, this little island,
dirt island is gonna be our triage and staging area right now.
translation.ko: '이 먼지 섬이 이제 우리의 초진실이다' 했어요

translation.en: We had to make decisions on who was gonna live and who was gonna die.
translation.ko: 누가 살고 누가 죽을지를 판단해야 했습니다

translation.en: [William] One of the things we have in civilian medical world
is called the "Golden Hour."
Basically if you can get somebody to the trauma center
within 60 minutes from injury,
if you can get him there alive, they have a pretty good chance of surviving.
At least in the Western world.
At this point, I don't hear anybody calling,
translation.ko: 그때 전 아무 소리를 듣지 못했어요

translation.en: it's just a quiet little womb in there,
it's hotter than you know what.
Both men were covered in brick and debris from the waist down.
translation.ko: 두 남자 모두 벽돌과 파편으로 허리 아래가 덮여 있었는데

translation.en: Sérgio was actually more almost chest high.
You couldn't see that anything was broken or out of place,
translation.ko: 어디가 부러졌다거나 하는 건 보이지 않았지만

translation.en: but he was covered completely.
They both had severe lower extremity injuries.
translation.ko: 두 사람 모두 심각한 하반신 부상을 입었죠

translation.en: Gil, you could see, his left leg was folded up.
Uh, Sérgio, we presumed he's got that much weight on him, he's got crush injuries.
translation.ko: 세르지우는 너무 큰 무게에 짓눌려 압궤 손상이 예상됐어요

translation.en: I was able to start an IV on Gil Loescher.
translation.ko: 전 길 뢰셔에게 정맥 주사를 놓을 수 있었습니다

translation.en: I could not get to Sérgio de Mello well enough to get an IV going.
translation.ko: 세르지우에겐 그게 가능할 만큼 접근할 수가 없었고요

translation.en: I just physically couldn't get in there without lying on top of Gil.
translation.ko: 길 위에 눕지 않고선 물리적으로 들어갈 수가 없었습니다

translation.en: I knew we had no heavy equipment,
so I knew the only way we're gonna get these guys out is the old-fashioned way
translation.ko: 그 사람들을 꺼내려면 구식밖에 방법이 없단 걸 알았죠

translation.en: so I started taking bricks, you know, a couple of bricks at a time,
translation.ko: 그래서 한 번에 벽돌 두어 개를 치우기 시작했어요

translation.en: throwing them up in the opening,
go back down, get a couple more bricks
translation.ko: 다시 내려가서 몇 개를 가져와 던지며

translation.en: and just, to try to get these guys uncovered.
[Valentine] We saw about 185 people,
and we moved 130 of them in 55 minutes in whatever vehicle we could find,
translation.ko: 그 중 130명을 55분 사이에 눈에 보이는 차량에 실었습니다

translation.en: uh, Deuce and a Half, 5 tons, pick-up trucks.
[Kuhner] MPU's were arriving at this point
and they've set up a 360 degree security perimeter on the outside.
Sorry, I need you to back up.
We then set to work searching the building and looking for survivors.
translation.ko: 그런 다음 무너진 건물에서 생존자 수색을 시작했습니다

translation.en: [Valentine] Probably about an hour or so down the line,
I heard a cry that there's more people up here.
translation.ko: 위에 사람들이 더 있다는 외침을 들었습니다

translation.en: So I said, "Okay, I'm going upstairs to check."
I went floor to floor, room to room
till I got to the top floor and I heard another cry there,
translation.ko: 꼭대기 층까지 갔는데 외치는 소리가 또 들렸어요

translation.en: and that's where I met Bill.
About 40 minutes after I arrived, I hear somebody yelling from up above,
translation.ko: 도착한 지 40분쯤 지나 누군가가 위에서 외치는 게 들렸어요

translation.en: and the guy goes, "Do you need any help?"
And the last thing I wanted was somebody wo had no training down there,
translation.ko: 훈련이 안 된 사람은 절대 필요 없었어요

translation.en: gonna make more problem, knock more bricks down,
translation.ko: 벽돌이 더 떨어지게 할 수 있으니까요

translation.en: and I said, "You have any experience?"
and he said "I'm a New York City firefighter paramedic,"
translation.ko: 그랬더니 자신이 뉴욕시의 소방 응급구조사라고 하더군요

translation.en: and I said, "Come on down."
[Valentine] I looked at the hole
and I just said "Holy crap!"
Here would be the third floor...
looking at it from the side.
When it collapsed, the roof basically went...
And Sérgio's office would've been somewhere... in here.
The second floor had collapsed partially down.
They were basically here. Their heads were down.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 여기 있었어요 머리가 아래쪽에 있었죠

translation.en: Now, they would be next to each other. So this would, let's say, be Gil Loescher
translation.ko: 옆에 나란히 있었고 이쪽이 길 뢰셔라고 하죠

translation.en: here in his feet...
To his right behind him, on that diagram,
translation.ko: 이 그림으로 볼 때 바로 그의 오른쪽에

translation.en: Sérgio would be basically in the same position.
Several bodies were actually located in this area, over here.
translation.ko: 시신 여러 구가 이쪽 부분에 있었고요

translation.en: That were, the other people that were in the meeting.
We treat everybody in the EMS the same.
translation.ko: 우리는 응급구조 시 모든 사람을 똑같이 대합니다

translation.en: If I could have gotten Sérgio out first, would I?
translation.ko: 세르지우를 먼저 데리고 나올 수 있었다면 그랬을까요?

translation.en: All things being equal, maybe.
But if it could have been the President of United States
and I would've had to get Gil Loescher out first
physically to get room to pull Sérgio out.
translation.ko: 그를 끌어낼 수 있는 공간을 확보할 수 있었습니다

translation.en: I said "Let me go down, you've already gone your turn."
My little one-man hole in the ground became a two-man hole in the ground,
and we spent the next, uh, two, three hours working together like a team,
translation.ko: 우리는 이후 2, 3시간 동안 팀이 돼서 작업했습니다

translation.en: uh, trying to get these guys out of there.
[Valentine] I had to climb over two victims. First victim was a female.
translation.ko: 전 두 명의 희생자를 넘어가야 했습니다 첫 번째는 여성이었어요

translation.en: She had, uh, this side of the face covered with a concrete slab.
Uh, she had what we call agonal breaths, but still had a pulse.
translation.ko: 심정지 호흡 상태였지만 아직 맥박이 뛰었어요

translation.en: She had a real severe head injury, I knew she wasn't gonna be survivable.
translation.ko: 머리를 심각하게 다쳐서 생존할 거 같지 않았습니다

translation.en: I told her to hang on and I said "Keep your faith,
and I said that God is with you," and she squeezed my hand.
translation.ko: 주님이 함께하고 있다고요 그분은 제 손을 꽉 잡았습니다

translation.en: So I'm assuming, because in the medical community
translation.ko: 의료계에서 말하기론 가장 마지막에 상실되는 게

translation.en: the last thing that goes is your hearing,
so I really believe the lady heard me.
translation.ko: 그분은 제 말을 분명히 들었을 겁니다

translation.en: I quietly pray, and I tell him "Jesus loves you."
I do that automatically.
Some of my co-workers think I'm crazy, but, you know, that's who I am.
translation.ko: 그러는 절 미쳤다는 동료들도 있지만 그게 저입니다

translation.en: I continue to go down.
I finally got down to the bottom of the first floor,
and I heard two people, they were talking, and one was Sérgio,
translation.ko: 두 사람의 대화 소리를 들었는데 한 명이 세르지우였어요

translation.en: he was to the left of me and Gil was more or less straight right in front of me.
translation.ko: 저를 기준으로 왼쪽에 있었고 길은 제 앞쪽에 있었습니다

translation.en: He was conscious, he knew what was going on,
he knew what happened, he knew where he was.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 일어났는지 자신의 위치가 어딘지 알았어요

translation.en: Uh, he knew his name, he knew how old he was and where he was from.
translation.ko: 이름도 알았고 나이도 알았고 고향이 어딘지도 알았죠

translation.en: Uh, and he told me he was from Oxford, England.
He was an American working there.
I'm told that I was conscious for most of that time,
translation.ko: 제가 그 시간 동안 의식이 있었다고 하는데

translation.en: but I don't remember.
[Valentine] I told him, "I'm gonna continue to work while you talk."
translation.ko: 얘기하는 동안 제가 작업할 거라고 말했어요

translation.en: He was telling me about his family, his wife and his two lovely daughters.
translation.ko: 그는 가족 얘기를 했어요 아내와 사랑스러운 두 딸 얘기였죠

translation.en: I said, "This is my promise to you...
I will get you out of here alive if you stay with me."
The earth was smoldering.
We were digging with our bare hands.
We had no shovels or equipment.
We kept calling Sérgio's name over and over.
[Davie in English] My memory was of dirt. I was surprised about how much dirt there was.
I remember thinking I'm going to move a piece of rubble and he will be there.
translation.ko: 잔해 한 조각을 치우면 거기 계실 것 같았죠

translation.en: I then saw a slit.
I put my head in and called out again, and it was Sérgio.
translation.ko: 머리를 넣어 다시 불렀고 거기 그분이 있었습니다

translation.en: I just felt wonderful, you know.
He was alive, and, uh, and we'd found him.
[Salamé] We found a hole through which we were communicating.
translation.ko: 우리는 의사소통을 할 수 있는 구멍을 찾았습니다

translation.en: "Sérgio! Sérgio!"
In French... [speaks French]
"We will come and help you. Don't worry."
His first questions of me after I'd asked of him,
translation.ko: 제가 말을 한 다음 첫 질문을 하셨는데

translation.en: were concern for others in the team,
not of himself or of his circumstances.
translation.ko: 본인이나 본인의 상황에 관한 게 아니었습니다

translation.en: "Where is Carolina? Where are the others? Please look for them."
Um, "Don't stop."
[William] I was not aware that there were people still working outside of the base
translation.ko: 전 사람들이 여전히 밖에서 구조 작업 중인지 알 수가 없었죠

translation.en: of the opening. I didn't hear anybody.
translation.ko: 전 사람들이 여전히 밖에서 구조 작업 중인지 알 수가 없었죠 아무것도 안 들렸으니까요

translation.en: At this point I was able to yell out one of my sergeants.
translation.ko: 그때서야 전 하사 한 명한테 외칠 수 있었습니다

translation.en: I said, "Robbie, I need a rope.
I need something to haul this stuff out, I need lights."
translation.ko: '여기 있는 것들 끌어낼 거랑 전등도 필요해'

translation.en: I never saw any equipment, because he was a buck sergeant and as he came through,
translation.ko: 근데 장비는 못 봤습니다 그 친구가 신참이었는데 저한테 오는 동안 군 관계자들이 점점 나타났고

translation.en: now as more and more people were showing up from the army,
translation.ko: 저한테 오는 동안 군 관계자들이 점점 나타났고

translation.en: higher ranking, it was like, "Hey, we need that rope."
translation.ko: 높은 계급의 상사가 '우리 그 로프 필요해' 한 거죠

translation.en: You know, Captain would say "Give me the rope," and he'd say,
"Well, I need it for my first sergeant.
I'm a captain, give me the rope."
You know, "I need it and I'm a colonel, give me..."
Never got any of that stuff.
At that point both of them were lucid, conscious.
I'm just trying to keep them talking.
What I was taught was to get their minds off their injuries.
translation.ko: 부상자들이 부상 생각을 덜 하게 해야 한다고 배웠습니다

translation.en: The survival rate is greater
translation.ko: 그 상황에서 관심을 다른 데로 돌리면

translation.en: when we get their mind off of what's going on at that time.
Kind of put them in another area in their life.
translation.ko: 인생의 다른 시기를 떠올리게 하는 식으로요

translation.en: Get their mind away from Baghdad.
[Holbrooke] A seminal moment in Sérgio's life came
translation.ko: 세르지우의 인생에서 중대한 시점 중 하나는

translation.en: when East Timor was cut loose from Indonesia
translation.ko: 동티모르가 엄청난 투쟁과 집단학살을 겪은 후

translation.en: after tremendous fighting and genocide.
We needed a senior UN official to be in effect the president,
translation.ko: 우리는 더 이상 인도네시아의 일부가 아니고 "리처드 홀브루크 전 유엔 미국 대사"

translation.en: the power in an area which was no longer part of Indonesia
translation.ko: 아직 독립 국가도 아닌 이곳에 사실상 대통령 역할을 할

translation.en: and not yet an independent country.
Sérgio Vieira de Mello had the drive, the leadership and the skills to do it,
translation.ko: 세르지우 비에이라 데 멜루는 그걸 할 수 있는 추진력, 리더십, 기술이 있었고

translation.en: and it was the biggest test the UN had ever faced in the nation-building phase.
translation.ko: 유엔으로선 국가가 건설 중인 곳에서 맞는 최대의 시험이었죠

translation.en: [Larriera] I never heard of Timor in my life.
When I was proposed to go there, I, I could...
I couldn't in a million years have placed it on the map.
I was an economics officer
working in establishing the traditional structure of the new government.
translation.ko: 그 새 정부의 전통 구조를 수립하는 일을 도왔습니다

translation.en: I did know Sérgio Vieira de Mello from Brazil.
translation.ko: 브라질 출신의 세르지우 비에이라 데 멜루를 알고 있었죠

translation.en: My part of the government knew him as the SRSG.
The Special Representative of the Secretary General.
Um, one morning I was running along the beach road,
translation.ko: 어느 날 아침 해변을 따라 달리고 있는데

translation.en: and I saw this man running with someone else who looks like a bodyguard.
translation.ko: 그분이 경호원으로 보이는 사람과 달리는 게 보였어요

translation.en: He passed by and I looked at...
You know, I looked at the two and I realized this was the SRSG.
And I'm looking at him thinking,
"Well, I am a woman, here I am running on my own,
why does he need a bodyguard next to him? What a chicken."
[reporter] The two man who hold East Timor's immediate future in their hands
translation.ko: 동티모르의 미래를 손에 쥔 두 사람이

translation.en: enjoy another rapturous welcome in an East Timorese town.

translation.ko: 이날 샤나나 구즈망은 에르메라 리젠시의 왕으로 추대됐습니다

translation.en: By his side is the man with the real power in East Timor today.
translation.ko: 그의 옆에는 현재 동티모르의 실질적인 권력자가 있습니다

translation.en: Sérgio de Mello is East Timor's legal leader for the next two years
translation.ko: 세르지우 데 멜루는 동티모르가 완전한 독립을 이룰 때까지 앞으로 2년 동안

translation.en: as it makes its transition to full independence.
Here, Sérgio, a guy who in his early 20s,
you know, had preached against imperialism,
had thrown stones at Parisian police,
and suddenly he was in charge, he was the viceroy.
translation.ko: 갑자기 한 국가를 책임지는 총독이 됐어요

translation.en: [Peter Galbraith] United Nations gave Sérgio all the powers of a dictator,
translation.ko: 유엔은 세르지우에게 독재자의 모든 권한을 줬지만

translation.en: but he never dictated anything.
He set up a consultative council that included the top East Timorese leaders,
translation.ko: 그는 동티모르 최고 지도자들도 포함된 협의회를 설립했고 "피터 갤브레이스 유엔 부대표, 동티모르"

translation.en: and later a cabinet
which included the East Timorese leaders.
And he never took a decision that the East Timorese disagreed with.
translation.ko: 그리고 동티모르인들이 동의하지 않는 결정은 절대 하지 않았죠

translation.en: East Timor will have an elected representative body
translation.ko: 동티모르는 헌법의 뼈대를 구축할 국민을 위한 대표기구를

translation.en: working for the people to frame a constitution
translation.ko: 동티모르는 헌법의 뼈대를 구축할 국민을 위한 대표기구를 선거로 세울 것입니다

translation.en: that is of the people.
This is a momentous achievement.
Democracy looks to be in a very healthy state indeed.
[Larriera] The real first time when I talked to Sérgio
was at a formal dinner.
I arrived very early, and, um...
it turned out that the only person who was there,
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 도착한 한 사람이 있었는데

translation.en: the first person who was there was Sérgio.
No one else was there, so we... started chatting away.
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 없었기 때문에 우린 수다를 떨었어요

translation.en: He told me that he knew I was from Argentina, and that, uh,
translation.ko: 제가 아르헨티나 출신이란 걸 알고 있다고 했고

translation.en: he had spent the first days of his life in Argentina, in Buenos Aires,
translation.ko: 자신도 아르헨티나에서 생애 첫 나날들을 보냈다고 했죠 부에노스아이레스에서요

translation.en: and I was surprised to hear that.
As he was telling me this, he was drifting away in memories,
translation.ko: 얘기를 하는 동안 그는 추억에 잠겼어요

translation.en: until everyone suddenly arrived and our conversation was cut short.
translation.ko: 그리고 사람들이 갑자기 도착하자 대화는 끝났죠

translation.en: It was that time, it was that day that we had really, you know...
established a connection and liked each other.
He had told me he was separated, you know,
and I assumed that that was a legal separation.
It was later on that he told me that he was not legally separated.
translation.ko: 근데 나중에 말하더군요 법적으로 헤어진 건 아니라고요

translation.en: But I must say that in the beginning he was not, you know...
You know,
hundred percent clear from that.
[Power] Sérgio had gotten married very young to Annie
translation.ko: 세르지우는 무척 젊었을 때 애니와 결혼했고

translation.en: and I don't think when he had his two sons that he would've forecast
translation.ko: 두 아들이 생겼을 때만 해도 인생의 많은 시간을

translation.en: that so much of his life would be spent away from his home in France.
translation.ko: 프랑스의 집을 떠나서 보낼 거라곤 예측 못 했을 거예요

translation.en: He was never a terribly faithful husband.
He had relationships outside his marriage,
um, you know, couple of which were very, very public.
Uh, in Cambodia, he had lived with his girlfriend
and worked with her in the mission.
It was clear to everybody with whom we worked that,
um, we had a relationship.
It was, for me, very difficult because he was married
translation.ko: 전 정말 힘들었어요 왜냐하면 그는 유부남이었고

[William] As an anti-terrorism specialist,
I try to look at it from the terrorist point of view and I was thinking that,
translation.ko: 전 테러리스트의 관점으로 상황을 이렇게 봤습니다

translation.en: you know, "If I was a terrorist,
it would be so easy to drive a truck loaded with explosives down the driveway
translation.ko: '폭발물을 실은 트럭을 몰고 와 유엔 바로 옆에서 터트리기는'

translation.en: and detonate it right next to the UN and blow it up."
translation.ko: '폭발물을 실은 트럭을 몰고 와 유엔 바로 옆에서 터트리기는' '식은 죽 먹기이겠다'

translation.en: I recommended strongly that they put in a large reinforced gate
translation.ko: 카날 호텔 진입로에 출입문을 보강해서 세워야 한다고

translation.en: at the entrance to the Canal road driveway,
but it was a very busy road and they were concerned the traffic
translation.ko: 하지만 몹시 붐비는 길이라 주차장에 진입하려는 차들로

translation.en: trying to get into the parking lot would queue up,
and they'd have accidents and it would just be a mess and...
translation.ko: 그로 인해 사고라도 나면 대혼란이 예상된다고...

translation.en: I reported back that I thought, you know,
it'd be better to have a few fender-bender accidents
translation.ko: 누가 트럭을 돌진해와서 빌딩을 폭파시키는 것보다

translation.en: than have somebody drive a truck up the driveway and blow up the building.
translation.ko: 누가 트럭을 돌진해와서 빌딩을 폭파시키는 것보다 가벼운 사고 몇 건이 낫다고요

translation.en: In lieu of the gate that I'd recommended,
the 2nd Cavalry had supplied them
with a Bradley armored fighting vehicle and a crew,
translation.ko: 브래들리 장갑 전투차 한 대와 군인을 배치해줬습니다

translation.en: and they were basically the valet parking.
translation.ko: 그리고 기본적으로 주차 대행을 하고 있었죠

translation.en: Later on, I noticed the vehicle was gone
and there was nothing there except a roll of concertina wire across the driveway,
and I was, like, "Uh-oh."
When I spoke to somebody at the UN, I said "What happened to it?"
And they said, "Oh, Sérgio ordered it moved." I'm, like, "Oh, Jesus."
He was trying to tone down the American presence at the UN compound,
translation.ko: 유엔 시설물에서 미국의 흔적을 줄이려고 한 거죠

translation.en: so it didn't look like the UN was, you know, part of the coalition forces.
translation.ko: 유엔을 연합군의 일부로 보이지 않게 하려고요

translation.en: The UN is ruled by the Jews and the Americans
and its crimes are flagrant in the Arab and Islamic world.
translation.ko: 그들의 범죄는 아랍과 이슬람 세계에서 악명 높습니다

translation.en: Zarqawi told me he needed to hit a big target - to recruit followers.
translation.ko: 자르카위는 추종자들을 모집하기 위해 대형 목표물을 공격해야 한다고 말했습니다

translation.en: Zarqawi said that the UN was a nest for secret services and American spies.
He said he needed to attack the UN
and kill that criminal Sérgio.
On that Monday, he told me that he...
he really needed something to look on to the future.
We needed to get going and start planning immediately
on our next steps, on our next move.
And really our next move had been to go back to Brazil.
Monday night he said, "Carolina, let's book the flights
and make sure that we have a clear exit strategy.
Because I need to be thinking that I'm going back to Brazil, I'm going back to Rio."
We were six weeks away from leaving Baghdad.
[William] They say time flies when you're having fun.
Well, I certainly wasn't having fun but time was flying.
And the golden hour, it came and went, we didn't even realize it.
translation.ko: 그리고 골든아워가 왔다가 간 걸 우린 몰랐죠

translation.en: I'm tired, my legs and arms were cramping.
translation.ko: 전 너무 지쳤고 팔다리가 경련을 일으켰어요

translation.en: We were driven, basically.
We were determined that these guys were not gonna die in this hole.
translation.ko: 이들은 이 구멍에서 죽지 않는다고 단호히 생각했고요

translation.en: I tried to get them into their, what I felt was their religious belief.
translation.ko: 전 그들이 종교적 믿음을 떠올리게 하려고 했어요

translation.en: [William] At one point Andre wanted to pray with Sérgio
translation.ko: 한순간 안드레가 세르지우랑 기도를 하려고 하더군요

translation.en: and he was still lucid enough to say if prayers...
You know, this is not the time,
uh, which I think kind of [chuckles] upset Andre a little bit.
translation.ko: 저 때문에 안드레가 화가 좀 났죠

translation.en: I asked him, you know, you got to have faith, you have to believe,
translation.ko: 전 믿음을 가져야 한다 믿어야 한다고 말했어요

translation.en: and he said, "Believe? Damn, God. God did this to me," you know.
translation.ko: 그랬더니 그가, '믿어요? 젠장, 신이 이렇게 했습니다'

translation.en: "Curse God." He was using some other words that I will not say,
um, and I was trying to tell him, "God didn't do this to you, man.
translation.ko: 전 이 말을 해주려 했죠 '주님이 이렇게 한 게 아니에요'

translation.en: You have to have faith this strong
to believe that God could get you out of here.
I'm you savior, in a sense.
You have to believe in me."
I've never had that experience.
In 35 years, nobody's ever said, "Hey, let's stop and pray."
translation.ko: 35년을 살면서 '잠깐, 멈추고 기도해요'란 말을 처음 들었죠

translation.en: What's so wrong with praying with somebody, you know?
It, it, uh... It wouldn't have hurt.
And Sérgio wanted no part of that, so, you know...
translation.ko: 그리고 세르지우가 원치 않았어요 그리고 그는...

translation.en: And he was... [chuckles]
expletive deleted "no," you know. He didn't want any part of that.
translation.ko: 욕설 부분은 제외하고 '아니'라 했어요 그걸 원치 않았죠

translation.en: I'm not a big prayer guy either. I was, like, I don't know if I...
translation.ko: 저도 기도를 열심히 하는 사람이 아니고 요령껏 이랬는지 아닌지 모르겠어요

translation.en: tactfully or untactfully said, "We haven't got time for this shit.
translation.ko: 요령껏 이랬는지 아닌지 모르겠어요 '우리 그거 할 시간 없습니다'

translation.en: Prayer's great, we'll pray when we get him out. But let's get him out."
translation.ko: '기도도 좋지만 우선 구조한 후에 하도록 하죠'

translation.en: [Larriera] There are some soldiers that told me to clear the area.
I said, "No, no, no, I'm going there because I hear that Sérgio's there."
translation.ko: 전 이랬죠, '안 돼요 세르지우가 있으니 들어갈 거예요'

translation.en: And the soldier comes to me and says,
"No, you know, you have to clear the area. You have to step back."
translation.ko: '안 돼요, 비켜 주셔야 합니다 물러나 주세요'

translation.en: And I said, "No, no."
After a period of time I started to figure out that
maybe there was something going on between her and somebody in there.
translation.ko: 안에 있는 누군가가 관계가 있나 보다 생각했습니다

translation.en: She was close with him or something, I don't know.
I could see she wanted to get up,
and I though about it for a second and I said, "You know what?
translation.ko: 잠시 생각한 후 말했어요 '저 사람들 얘기할 수 있도록 하죠'

translation.en: Let them talk to each other."
I gave her my hand, I let her come up,
she put her head on the hole and started talking.
translation.ko: 그녀는 구멍에 머리를 대고 말을 시작했어요

translation.en: I put my ear and my mouth very close to the hole
translation.ko: 전 귀와 입을 구멍에 바짝 붙여

translation.en: and I, I say...
Sérgio, are you there?
And a very weak voice says, "Carolina, my love, I'm in pain, I'm here.
translation.ko: 그리고 무척 약한 소리를 들었죠 '캐롤리나, 내 사랑 나 아파, 여기 있어'

translation.en: I love you."
And I tell him I love him too...
to be strong...
and I'm going to get him out.
At this point, Gil is reacting to some verbal stimuli, but not much.
translation.ko: 그즈음 길은 음성 자극에 반응을 보였으나 크진 않았습니다

translation.en: You can't get really more than a word or two in reply.
translation.ko: 한두 단어 이상은 답을 들을 수 없었어요

translation.en: We got to get him out, we know we got to get him out,
we got to get him out now.
But the problem is he's still pinned from his lower legs.
translation.ko: 그러나 문제는 다리가 여전히 깔려있단 거였죠

translation.en: Where Sérgio was, Gil had to be removed first.
translation.ko: 세르지우를 구조하려면 길을 먼저 구조해야 했습니다

translation.en: I said, "Buddy, you know, I've done the best I can,
and if I don't get you out now, we're never gonna get out."
translation.ko: '지금 못 데리고 나가면 절대 못 데리고 나가요'

translation.en: So he said, "Do what you have to do,
and I just wanna live and I wanna go home."
My memory of it is that, you know, I'm just not going to give in.
I'm not going to die. I have...
a lot to live for, you know. I...
You know, I thought...
[voice breaking] immediately of my family.
A decision was made and, uh, we all agreed on it,
and the most important thing was Gil was ready for it.
translation.ko: 가장 중요한 건 길이 준비되는 거였죠

translation.en: The only thing they found me was an old rusty wood saw
translation.ko: 사람들이 찾아다 준 도구는 녹슨 나무 톱과

translation.en: and my trusty paramedic scissors.
I said, "I'm gonna start sawing away.
If you have to scream out, scream out.
If the pain is unbearable, let me know and I will stop
translation.ko: '통증을 참을 수 없으면 말하세요' '중단하고 진통제를 더 드릴게요'

translation.en: and give you some more pain medicine."
I don't remember any of that. I've... blacked that out.
translation.ko: 전 아무 기억이 안 나요 의식을 잃었습니다

translation.en: [Valentine] I started to cut through his first leg.
I had to kind of separate his screaming from what I had to do,
translation.ko: 그의 비명과 제가 해야 할 일을 별개로 구분해야 했죠

translation.en: 'cause I knew it had to be done.
Even with morphine, even being deeply in shock
translation.ko: 모르핀이 투여되고 그는 엄청난 충격 속에

translation.en: and basically reacting only to pain,
it was pretty gruesome work. Um...
He screamed. I mean, you probably could've heard the screams in, you know,
translation.ko: 그는 비명을 질렀고 아마도 그 소리는

translation.en: the green zone.
We felt terrible, but we knew if we didn't do this,
he would die where he was, because we physically couldn't get him out.
translation.ko: 물리적으로 못 꺼내니 그 자리에서 사망할 테니까요

translation.en: I pulled tighter on the tourniquet,
and I told him I'm gonna go to the second leg.
translation.ko: 그리고 두 번째 다리를 하겠다고 했어요

translation.en: He didn't answer for a while, for a few minutes, I thought I'd lost him.
translation.ko: 잠시, 몇 분간 대답하지 않길래 그가 잘못된 줄 알았습니다

translation.en: What I believe what happened was,
the pain was so bad that it literally just knocked him out.
So, in a way, that was probably a blessing.
I started to cut into the second leg and he woke up again,
translation.ko: 전 두 번째 다리 절단을 시작했고 그는 정신이 돌아왔습니다

translation.en: and he started to moan and he just said, "Andre, I feel that,
but go ahead and do it and finish."
Um, and I did. I finished cutting the second leg,
translation.ko: 전 그렇게 했습니다 두 번째 다리를 절단하고

translation.en: pulled tighter on the tourniquet, and I bandaged it.
[William] We finally got a Sked.
It's an acronym for something and I have no idea what it is,
but it's this plastic roll-up thing
translation.ko: 플라스틱 재질로 된 돌돌 말린 것으로

translation.en: that when you unroll it and lace the sides
it forms a semi-rigid stretcher.
[Valentine] I got him in the best I can,
and the team up on top was just waiting on me to say go ahead and go.
translation.ko: 위에 있는 팀은 저의 시작 지시를 기다렸습니다

translation.en: They pulled, and they pulled, and they pulled.
The reinforcing rod was blocking one part of the small opening
translation.ko: 철근이 작은 구멍의 한 부분을 막고 있었고

translation.en: and the body was blocking the other.
We tried to pull the SKD past it, it wouldn't fit.
translation.ko: 우린 들것을 통과시키려 했지만 크기가 안 맞았어요

translation.en: Since we never got the hacksaw, we couldn't move the reinforcing rod.
translation.ko: 금속 절단용 쇠톱이 없었기 때문에 철근을 옮길 수가 없었죠

translation.en: So the only other way to get Gil up was to
translation.ko: 그래서 길을 위로 올리는 유일한 방법은

translation.en: remove the body that was pinned in the rubble
part way up.
So I had the unenviable task of, uh, using my combat knife again to, uh,
translation.ko: 그래서 전 어쩔 수 없이 컴뱃 나이프를 또 꺼내

translation.en: cut the body in half so they could haul it.
translation.ko: 시신을 반으로 절단했습니다 거기를 통과할 수 있도록요

translation.en: [exhales] And if you think cutting a leg off was fun...
translation.ko: 다리를 절단하는 게 재밌을 거 같다면...

translation.en: Uh, now even though the victim was dead and obviously deceased...
it was still hard work.
[Valentine] And they finally got Gil up.
I looked at him and I said, "Gil, you're free, you're home now.
translation.ko: 그를 보며 말했죠 '길, 당신은 이제 자유예요 집에 왔습니다'

translation.en: I'm gonna give you to my other guys and they will take you to the doctors."
[Loescher] My family was my anchor.
I probably knew instinctively that if I got out of there...
translation.ko: 전 본능적으로 알았던 것 같아요 거기서 나오면...

translation.en: that they would, uh...
[sighs] see me through my recovery.
translation.ko: 내가 회복해 내는 걸 볼 거라고요

translation.en: He was close to death when they got him out there.
His vital signs were, like, 60 over 40 for blood pressure,
uh, and they did a hot load into one of the medivac helicopters and flew him away.
translation.ko: 재빨리 응급 수송 헬기에 실려 병원으로 날아갔어요

translation.en: I spotted this man. I rushed to him and I asked him,
translation.ko: 전 어떤 사람을 보고 달려가 말했어요

translation.en: "Please, I need your help. I need your help.
My Sérgio is in the rubble, and he is going to die if...
translation.ko: '세르지우가 잔해 속에 있어요 그를 꺼내지 않으면'

translation.en: if we don't help him out."
He told me, "I have news for you.
Do you see that helicopter, the black copter that just left off?"
And I said, "Yes, yes."
"That is passing by now? That's probably...
the helicopter with him. But I have bad news for you,
and you have to be strong.
To free him out we had to cut his legs
and he is in a very bad shape.
One of his arms is also in very bad shape."
I said, "Okay, it doesn't matter. Is he alive?
I don't care about his legs, is he alive?"
"Yes."
[Valentine] His mind was starting to go. He wasn't talking much anymore.
translation.ko: 그는 정신을 잃기 시작했고 말수도 없어졌습니다

translation.en: He was... You could hear his breathing was a lot more erratic
and, and, uh, irregular and stuff,
and I just went over there and I continued to encourage him,
translation.ko: 전 가까이 가서 계속 용기를 북돋웠습니다

translation.en: I tried to, uh, hold his hand,
and you know, lay next to him and put my head on him,
translation.ko: 그 옆에 누워서 머리를 갖다 댔어요

translation.en: uh, so he'll know that somebody was there.
translation.ko: 누가 옆에 있단 걸 알게 하려고요

translation.en: I went back over to talk to Sérgio, tell him we'll get you out next,
translation.ko: 전 세르지우한테 돌아가서 이제 나갈 차례라고 말했어요

translation.en: he didn't reply to me. Shook him, he didn't reply to me.
translation.ko: 대답을 안 하더군요 몸을 흔들었지만 대답이 없었어요

translation.en: Felt for a pulse, and there wasn't one.
We weren't gonna get him out, and that kind of hit me like a ton of bricks.
translation.ko: 그를 꺼낼 수 없게 됐죠 전 무거운 돌에 맞은 듯했습니다

translation.en: [Larriera] I, I felt there is something wrong. I know there was something wrong.
translation.ko: 뭔가 잘못된 거 같았어요 뭔가 잘못돼 있었어요

translation.en: I hear on the back...
someone saying Sérgio's dead.
Sérgio's dead. [sobs]
No.
No.
[softly] I wanted to die.
He failed me. He really failed me.
I really believe God sent two miracles.
translation.ko: 전 신이 2개의 기적을 보냈다고 정말 믿거든요

translation.en: Bill and myself, we were his angels,
and he failed both of us.
And it hurt real bad.
I'm mad at him, but I'm also hurt for him,
because he didn't believe in me. He didn't believe in a miracle.
translation.ko: 절 안 믿었으니까요 기적을 안 믿었으니까요

translation.en: We only asked him to stay alive, have the will to survive,
translation.ko: 살아 있어 달라고만 했어요 살겠단 의지를 가지라고요

translation.en: have the faith to survive and he didn't want to.
translation.ko: 믿음을 가지라고 했는데 그걸 원하지 않았어요

translation.en: Maybe he's misconstruing where he's saying...
you know, basically don't worry about me, get everybody else out first.
translation.ko: '내 걱정은 마, 딴 사람들 먼저 구해' 이 부분에서요

translation.en: Maybe he's construing that as not a will to live.
translation.ko: 그가 살 의지가 없었던 거로 오해했을 겁니다

translation.en: I look at that as being pretty selfless.
I don't think that's a lack of will to live, I think that's, you know,
translation.ko: 그건 살려는 의지가 부족한 게 아니라

translation.en: I think that's a pretty damn good thing.
I told him, "I promise I'm gonna get you out." And I didn't.
I felt almost, like, he knew I lied to him.
translation.ko: 제가 거짓말하는 걸 알았다는 느낌이 들었어요

translation.en: To this day, it's probably the thing that bothers me the most is that
I truly felt that I'd get both of these guys out alive.
translation.ko: 정말로 두 사람 모두 생존시킬 수 있을 것 같았단 겁니다

translation.en: [Bremer] A soldier covered with sweat and dirt came over and he said,
translation.ko: 한 군인이 땀과 흙으로 범벅이 된 채 다가와 말했습니다

translation.en: Mr. Ambassador, I'm very sorry, we tried to save Sérgio,
but he's dead.
Now the press were clamoring for an interview.
I could not say that I knew Sérgio was dead because
translation.ko: 전 세르지우의 사망 사실을 말할 수 없었어요

translation.en: I couldn't have his family find out by my making a statement on television,
translation.ko: 유가족이 그 사실을 TV를 통해 알게 할 순 없었기 때문이죠

translation.en: so I basically lied.
[reporter] Excuse me, sir.
Sérgio Vieira de Mello apparently also has been injured in this attack...
translation.ko: 세르지우 비에이라 데 멜루 특사도 이번 공격으로 다치셨는데...

translation.en: Yes, that's right. As of this time,
my dear friend Sérgio is somewhere back there.
translation.ko: 친애하는 친구 세르지우는 저기 어딘가에 있습니다

translation.en: Uh, it may well be that he was the target of this attack.
translation.ko: 그가 이 공격의 대상이었을 수도 있습니다

translation.en: The truck was parked in such a place, here in front of the building
that it had to affect his office which was in the second floor above us.
translation.ko: 그의 집무실에 영향을 줄 수밖에 없었습니다, 여기 3층이었어요

translation.en: What strikes me about the rescue is just the utter indignity
translation.ko: 구조에 있어서 충격이었던 건 세르지우를 3시간 반이나

translation.en: of Sérgio being left under the rubble for three and a half hours,
translation.ko: 잔해 속에 있게 한 말도 안 되는 모욕이었어요

translation.en: for them to be relying upon a lady's handbag and a curtain rope?
translation.ko: 여성용 핸드백과 커튼 끈이 고작 다였다고요?

translation.en: Are we kidding?
This is the United States.
And the degree to which the political planners of this war failed
translation.ko: 이 전쟁의 정치적 입안자들 수준은 세르지우와

translation.en: not only Sérgio and the UN officials and others who were killed that day,
translation.ko: 이 전쟁의 정치적 입안자들 수준은 세르지우와 그날 사망한 유엔 직원들뿐 아니라

translation.en: but also their own soldiers who put their lives on the line in that way.
translation.ko: 목숨을 걸고 구조에 나선 자신들의 군인들도 실망시켰어요

translation.en: Terrible. Terrible.
[Davie] He was lying on his flag, in the rubble.
translation.ko: 그는 잔해 속에서 깃발 위에 누워있었습니다

translation.en: The United Nations flag.
The, uh, the team...
above then, uh, pulled...
and, uh, slowly we were able to take him up, uh,
up the shaft.
Gaby was up there and some of his other, uh, bodyguards, and, uh, and they...
translation.ko: 가비가 거기에 와 있었고 다른 경호원들도...

translation.en: took one of the stretchers and, uh,
and laid him on... Sorry.
We put him on a stretcher.
We looked at him and we thought, "Everything he did in the world...
translation.ko: 그 모습을 보며 생각했어요 '이걸 위해 그 모든 걸'

translation.en: for this."
Impossible to understand.
[in English] We were standing up there in the second floor and the body came,
and, uh, it was put on a...
Uh, and I recognized him. His face was...
translation.ko: 그를 알아볼 수 있었습니다 얼굴이 전혀...

translation.en: entirely intact.
And he looked handsome as usual, I remember.
I received a call
that he had died.
I felt like crying, screaming
but my Grandmother was here
and she didn't know.
She didn't know anything.
So I controlled myself as much as possible,
translation.ko: 그래서 최대한 제 감정 조절을 했습니다

translation.en: went to the bedroom and cried for a bit
translation.ko: 그리고 방으로 가서 좀 운 다음에

translation.en: then pulled my head together and took care of it.
That was when my world collapsed inside my head.
[voice breaking] To have a son like that
translation.ko: 그렇게 훌륭한 자질을 지닌 아들을 두고 살았는데

translation.en: with such good qualities
and it ends like that.
I miss him immensely.
Now, I can't say I've come out of the tunnel,
translation.ko: 이제 터널에서 나왔다고 말할 수는 없지만

translation.en: but I'm walking.
And often I go to the Cemetery of Kings
where Sérgio's body is buried
and I talk to him.
Now he's up in there in the sky
and certainly still trying to save some people up there.
I know one day I'll meet him again.
But I really can't forgive the people who did this to him.
translation.ko: 하지만 이런 짓을 한 사람들을 용서할 순 없습니다

translation.en: [in English] I was really impressed with his stoicism.
Never asked about himself, he asked about others, you know.
translation.ko: 자신에 대해 묻지 않고 남들에 대해서만 물었죠

translation.en: Never asked for anything for himself in the way of pain medicine.
translation.ko: 전통제 같은 것도 전혀 요구하지 않았어요

translation.en: He was always asking, "Take care of the others,"
and I thought somebody should know that.
translation.ko: 전 누군가는 그걸 알아야 한다고 생각했죠

translation.en: I didn't know who to contact, I didn't know where he was from.
translation.ko: 누구한테 연락할지 그가 어디서 왔는진 모르지만

translation.en: I just knew his boss was Kofi Annan.
So that night on my broken and battered laptop computer,
translation.ko: 그래서 그날 밤 낡고 깨진 제 노트북 컴퓨터로

translation.en: I wrote a letter to Kofi Annan.
19th August, 2003.
[sniffles] You know, I'm not gonna get through this.
"Subject: Sérgio Vieira de Mello.
As you are painfully aware, at approximately 1630 today local time,
a horrible disaster occurred
[voice breaks] at the UN headquarters in Baghdad.
I was the first US soldier to arrive on the scene, and the sight was catastrophic.
translation.ko: '전 현장에 처음 도착한 미군이고 그 광경은 정말 처참했습니다'

translation.en: Unfortunately, Mr. de Mello passed away.
While there is no good way to die, it says a lot about a man's character
translation.ko: '죽음을 맞는 좋은 방법이란 없지만 마지막에 하는 생각이'

translation.en: when his last thoughts are for his family, his co-workers,
translation.ko: '가족, 동료, 국가, 혹은 이 경우 유엔에 대한 걱정이라면'

translation.en: and his country, or in this case, the UN.
translation.ko: '그 인물에 대해 많은 걸 말해주는 것 같습니다'

translation.en: I'm truly sorry we could not
have kept our promise to get him out alive.
The UN is fortunate to have people of this caliber working for them.
I salute all of them
and hope that your mission in Iraq will conclude successfully.
Mr. de Mello was a humanitarian of the first order.
He will be hard to be replaced."
[Kofi Annan] Today we share our shock and sorrow
at the loss of people we loved.
All of them leave a huge void.
Raid, Leen, Ihsan, Emaad, and Basim,
translation.ko: 라이드, 린, 이산 이마드, 그리고 바심

translation.en: Rahim, Ranillo, Rick, Reza,
Jean-Sélim, Christopher, Martha,
Fiona, Nadia,
finally, Sérgio, my dear friend.
Why did you never seem tired
while even working 18-hour days?
Why did you never look crumpled
even after an 18-hour flight?
Why were you never sick?
Why were you never grumpy?
And you were the only top official in the UN known to everyone
translation.ko: 당신은 성을 뺀 이름만으로도 모두에게 알려진

translation.en: by his first name.
Even to those who didn't know you personally
you were always just Sérgio.
[Power] It is heartening that around the world,
translation.ko: 전 세계에 끼친 무척 고무적인 일입니다

translation.en: whether in the United Nations missions
or in humanitarian organizations or in governments,
you do have individuals who ask themselves
what would Sérgio do.
The one answer that they know he would give is,
translation.ko: 그들이 예상하는 한 가지 대답은 이거일 것입니다

translation.en: "Get out of the capital and go out into the world
and figure out what's happening.
Figure out what's making people tick.
Respect the dignity of the human beings whose lives are at stake here.
Don't treat them as a model if there is a mass.
Engage the bad guys.
Be a man of action,
but also never stop being a man of reflection."
[Larriera] I wish I could have an elastic time.
translation.ko: 시간을 탄력적으로 쓸 수 있다면 얼마나 좋을까요

translation.en: To be able to go back to the past and stretch out some special moments to a maximum.
translation.ko: 과거로 돌아가 특별했던 순간들을 최대한으로 늘이고 싶어요

translation.en: Now we know where that, uh, those times are finished and, uh...
and... they won't happen again.
When I finally made it back to Brazil, I went to this spot.
translation.ko: 마침내 브라질로 돌아갔을 때 전 그곳에 갔어요

translation.en: The spot where we will always arrive
every time we would hit the ground in Brazil,
and go straight into the water at the sea.
I really felt the strength of his spirit and the kindness of his spirit
translation.ko: 그의 영혼의 힘과 그리고 영혼의 따뜻함이

translation.en: were right there.
That's where I feel that... that Sérgio is now.
translation.ko: 세르지우가 함께 있단 게 느껴지는 곳이죠

translation.en: And where I feel that, uh, he really, really rests forever.
translation.ko: 그리고 영원히 편히 쉬고 있단 게 느껴지는 곳이고요

translation.en: [Sérgio] My message is very simple.
Never forget that the real challenges
and the real rewards of serving the United Nations
are out there in the field,
where people are suffering, where people need you.
translation.ko: 여러분을 필요로하는 현장에 있단 걸 항상 기억하십시오

translation.en: So, good luck. Welcome to the organization,
translation.ko: 좋은 결실을 보길 바라고 이 기구에 오신 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: and here we are to help you in any way we can.
All the best.
Okay.
